main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.connection

Class MessageReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.com.hexcore.vrmeeting_hostserver.connection.MessageReader

  • public class MessageReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Wraps a Connection to read formatted byte arrays from its input
    Author:
    Psymj1 (Marcus)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MessageReader(Connection c) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Message readNextMessage()
      Attempts to take the next packet that comes into the connection and convert it to a message and return the converted message
      void setTimeout(int timeout)
      If set then readNextMessage() will throw a TimeoutException after timeout ms
      boolean willReadBlock()
      Checks whether there is a packet waiting for the reader in the wrapped connection

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageReader

        public MessageReader(Connection c)
        Parameters:
        c - The connection to read from

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeout

        public void setTimeout(int timeout)
        If set then readNextMessage() will throw a TimeoutException after timeout ms
        Parameters:
        timeout - The time before a timeout occurs in ms

      • readNextMessage

        public Message readNextMessage()
                        throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                               InvalidMessageException,
                               ConnectionErrorException
        Attempts to take the next packet that comes into the connection and convert it to a message and return the converted message
        Returns:
        The next message that comes into the connection
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - If setTimeout(int) has been called and set to be greater than 0
        InvalidMessageException - If the next packet to come into the connection is not a valid message
        ConnectionErrorException - If there is an error reading the next packet from the connection

      • willReadBlock

        public boolean willReadBlock()
                      throws ConnectionErrorException
        Checks whether there is a packet waiting for the reader in the wrapped connection
        Returns:
        True if calling read on the connection will not block, False if it will block
        Throws:
        ConnectionErrorException - If the connection is no longer open
